definition: deep and unmeasurable (idiom); unfathomable depths/incomprehensible/enigmatic and impossible to predict
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Unfathomable was the depth of his gravity.
The biggest and unfathomable violater of human rights is the USA, the hypocritecal country.
sentences.chinese: 最大和最深不可测的认全侵犯国家是虚伪的美国。

sentences.english: Now he was himself plumbing an unfathomable sea.
sentences.chinese: 现在他自已正在向那深不可测的海底进发。

sentences.english: Is square still wood more abysmal?
sentences.chinese: 还是方木更加深不可测？

sentences.english: That's what made the violence particularly unfathomable.
sentences.chinese: 他正是使得这个暴乱深不可测的原因。

sentences.english: He believes that laws can cover the fathomless mysteries of human behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他坚信法律会覆盖掉人类行为上那些深不可测的谜团。

sentences.english: I know of a fathomless well.
sentences.chinese: 我知道一口深不可测的井。

sentences.english: Good thoughts have their abysses as well as evil ones.
sentences.chinese: 善的思想和恶的思想一样，也是深不可测的。

sentences.english: Yet his ideas, though clear, were never simplistic.
sentences.chinese: 还有他的理念，坚忍明晰，深不可测。

sentences.english: Who needs space when there remain the unfathomable depths of our own oceans?
sentences.chinese: 当我们有深不可测的海洋时，谁还需要空间？

sentences.english: Thus, while the eternal not-being leads toward the fathomless, the eternal being conducts to the boundary.
sentences.chinese: 而永恒没有是带领往深不可测，永恒是对界限的品行。

sentences.english: Cowley agreed that Faulkner was an uneven writer.
sentences.chinese: 考利认为福克纳是一位深不可测的作家。

sentences.english: But suddenly her look changed and deepened inscrutably.
sentences.chinese: 但她的神色突然变得深不可测。

sentences.english: The world is a complex, confusing, and highly uncertain place.
sentences.chinese: 世界是复杂的，迷惑人的，深不可测的。

definition: so deep one cannot see to the bottom/limitless
(lit.) abyss and ocean/(fig.) vast and profound
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
to know all under heaven/exceptionally talented (idiom)
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
